description:
Replacement of existing timber framed front windows, with double glazed white powder coated aluminium clad window frames and the erection of a security fence and gate to front.
This application may affect the character and appearance of the conservation area.  Town and Country Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended); section 73.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: The proposed security fence and gate to the front elevation are not granted planning permission within this application. The proposed fence and gate by reason of their inappropriate design and choice of finishing materials fails to bear any relationship with the surrounding properties within the mews. The proposed fence and gate is considered to have a detrimental impact on the character and appearance of the host property and the wider setting of the mews development within the St Mary Magdelene Church Conservation Area.

REASON: In order to preserve and/or enahnce the character appearance of the host buildinmg and the wider conservation area setting.
